description: Assesses research-based argumentative writing with multiple sources

levels.4: Research is thorough with multiple credible sources that provide strong support
levels.3: Research uses adequate sources that support the argument
levels.2: Research is thin, relying on few or weak sources
levels.1: Little to no research evident; mostly unsupported claims

feedback_stems.strength: Your research was thorough and well-sourced, especially
feedback_stems.growth: Deepen your research—find more credible sources to strengthen your argument

levels.4: Argument is built logically from research; claims, evidence, and reasoning work together
levels.3: Argument is clear with research supporting main claims
levels.2: Argument exists but research and claims don't connect well
levels.1: No clear argument constructed from the research

feedback_stems.strength: You built a strong argument from your research, particularly
feedback_stems.growth: Connect each piece of evidence to a specific claim—show how research proves your point

levels.4: Sources are smoothly integrated with proper attribution and analysis
levels.3: Sources are cited and generally well-integrated
levels.2: Sources are present but dropped in awkwardly or without analysis
levels.1: Sources are missing or used without attribution

feedback_stems.strength: You integrated sources smoothly, especially when
feedback_stems.growth: Introduce, embed, and analyze each source—don't just drop quotes in

levels.4: Multiple sources synthesized to build a unique argument; sources in conversation

feedback_stems.strength: You synthesized multiple sources to build your argument effectively
feedback_stems.growth: Put your sources in conversation with each other—how do they connect?
